Docs.summary: Collects the characteristics associated with flow layouts.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutSettings> class collects and manages the characteristics associated with the flow layout scheme. This class is used internally by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> classes, as well as the flow layout engine. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutSettings> class is used by the layout engine to determine how to layout the container's child controls.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutSettings> class manages the following information:
- The flow direction of consecutive controls.
- Whether the contents should be wrapped or clipped if the child controls cannot be contained within their parent.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutSettings> does not have a public constructor.

## Remarks If the area of the container is too small to display all the child controls, then at least one control will be clipped regardless of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutSettings.WrapContents%2A> value.
Subsequent resizing of the container will reapply the layout to the contained controls.
